result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica S Mcguigan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jessica S Mcguigan was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jessica S Mcguigan is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jessica S Mcguigan was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jessica S Mcguigan was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-CASH BONDS APPLIED.
-To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Counseling as recommended by the Agent and any follow-up.
-DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Court stays the jail sentence and is to be used by the Agent for disciplinary purposes.

supervisions.notes: -Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Jail.  Sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentence.
-Court orders the court costs of $343.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Inmate Request to the Court (Ct approves huber)
Revoked, Sentenced to Co Jail/HOC - 02/11/2019

11:09 a.m.  (Judge Bult via video from Marquette County)  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding cousel.  Statement by defendant will waive counsel and will proceed on her own.  Court questions defendant regarding proceeding without counsel.  Statement by defendant - will proceed alone.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Defendant has received a copy of the revocation summary and makes statement.  Statement by DA Christenson regarding sentence recommendation.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Count 1 - 90 days county jail in the Green Lake County Jail and is to be consecutive to any other sentence.
-Count 2 - 9 months county jail in the Green Lake County Jail and is to be concurrent to count 1.

Court orders the court costs of $343 on count 1 and court costs of $243 on counrt 2 be reduced to civil judgments.

Court grants the defendant 157 days of sentence credit.
Court remands the defendant to custody of the Green Lake County Jail.

Court adjourned at 11:23 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
10:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - jury trial was held on 15CM198.  Statement by Atty Lennon - prepared to go to sentencing on 2015CM198 and State will dismiss 2016CM270.  Further statement by Atty Lennon - defendant is not happy with him as counsel and is looking for another attorney.  Statement by defendant, is prepared to get her own attorney.  Statement by the Court - can either proceed today or the sentencing can be re-set.  Atty Lennon recites offer, no offer on 2015CM198, will be argued and State agrees to dismiss 2016CM270.  Statement by defendant - requests the sentencing be adjourned.  Statement by Atty Christenson regarding adjournment - opposes the request.

Further statement by the Court - it is not appropriate to re-set this matter and denies the request for new counsel and will proceed with sentencing today.  

Sentencing argument by DA - moves to dismiss 2016CM270 and requests probation on one count and jail time on the other count.  Sentencing argument by Atty Lennon.  Statement by the defendant.  Further statement by Atty Lennon.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Court will dismiss and read-in 2016CM270.

Count 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-45 days county jail, stayed and is to be used by the Agent for disciplinary purposes.
-Counseling as recommended by the Agent and any follow-up.
-Court costs.
-DNA sample.

Count 2

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

 CONDITIONS:

-45 days county jail, stayed and is to be used by the Agent for disciplinary purposes.
-Counseling as recommended by the Agent and any follow-up.
-Court costs.
-DNA sample.

Court adjourned at 10:32 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on May 1, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges

9:11 a.m.  Andrew Christenson appears on behalf of the State.  Defendant Jessica McGuigan appears with attorney William Lennon.
Court statement to the jurors.  Jurors sworn by Clerk.  Voire Dire started.  Peremptory begins and is completed.  Jurors impaneled and sworn.  Court releases remaining jurors.  Jurors to the jury room.  Court recess 9:58 a.m.  Court reconvenes 10:21 a.m.  Same appearances.  Court goes over preliminary instructions.  No objections.  Jurors brought into courtroom.  Court reads opening instructions to jurors.  Opening statement by DA Christenson.  Atty Lennon reserves opening statement.  Robert O'Claire sworn, direct by DA Christenson.  DA Christenson offers exhibit 1.  Recording played.  No objections to exhibit 1 - Court receives.  Cross exam by Atty Lennon.  No re-direct.  Deputy Tyler Hoerig sworn, direct by DA Christenson.  Cross exam by Atty Lennon.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  No re-cross.  Deputy Troy Schroeder sworn, direct by DA Christenson.  DA Christenson offers exhibit 2.  DVD played.  No objections to exhibit 2 - Court receives.  Cross exam by Atty Lennon.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  Melissa Zamzow sworn, direct by DA Christenson.  DA Christenson offers exhibit 3.  No objections - Court receives.  No cross exam.  Jurors returned to jury room.  Statement by defendant.  Court advises defendant to consult with her attorney.  States rests.  Court recess 11:59 a.m.  Court reconvenes 1:06 p.m.  Same appearances.  Statement by Atty Lennon.  Court colloquy of defendant.  Court questions Atty Lennon.  Jurors returned to court room.  Atty Lennon gives opening statement.  Defense rests.  Jurors returned to jury room.  Court statement to counsel regarding jury instructions and verdicts.  Court recess 1:22 p.m.  Court reconvenes 2:25 p.m.  Same appearances.  Discussion held regarding closing jury instructions.  Jurors return to court room.  Court reads jury instructions to jurors.  Closing statement by DA Christenson.  Closing statement by Atty Lennon.  Rebuttal by DA Christenson.  Court reads further jury instructions to jurors.  Alternate juror sworn and released.  Bailiffs sworn.  Jurors to jury room for deliberations.  Court recess 3:09 p.m.  Court reconvenes 6:26 p.m.  Same appearances.  Court goes over questions from the jury.  Statement by Atty Lennon.  Statement by DA Christenson.  Court responds to juror questions.  Court recess 6:30 p.m.  Court reconvenes 6:35 p.m.  Same appearances.  Statement by Atty Lennon.  Court permits request of defendant.  Jurors return to court room.  DA Christenson replays exhibit 1.  Jurors returned to jury room to resume deliberations.  Court recess 6:43 p.m.  Court reconvenes 7:36 p.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors returned to court room.  Verdict reached.  Jury finds the defendant GUILTY to Count 1; GUILTY to Count 2; NOT GUILTY to Count 3.  Court polls each juror.  Court statement to jurors.  Jurors released.  Court enters judgment on verdicts as of today's date.  Court dismissed Count 3.  Atty Lennon requests sentencing be set at a later date as defendant has pending matter.  DA Christenson concurs.  Court will set this matter for sentencing and pending matter for plea hearing.  Counsel to be contacted to set dates.  Court advises defendant bond remains.  Court adjourned 7:46 p.m.

3:18 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant does not communicate very well and has not responded to letters written to her.  Statement by the Court - has received the motion to withdraw.  Court grants Atty Privat's request to withdraw and requests Atty Privat to write letter to the defendant informing her to contact the Public Defender's office and once counsel is appointed, the Court will address whether an inpatient competency should be ordered.If the PD's office will not appoint, the defendant can apply for court appointed counsel.
